channel.title: Need help with java! :(
channel.description: i was trying to make a server and my friend who has a server said that i have to put my java in my server files so i do it and i click run server and it works then i go to my clients and it says 'java' is not reconizeed as an internal or external command operable program or batch fiile. Press any key to continue . . . What do i do ?

item.title: Need help with java! :(
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Well I go to www.java.com and then I go to download java, and it Says:
Verify Java Version

Check to ensure that you have the recommended version of Java installed for your operating system.

                                               Verify Java Version.

I click that And it verify’s it And it goes to a different Page, and says this
Verifying Java Version
Oops! You don’t have the recommended Java installed.
Your Java version is 1.6.0-oem. Please click the button below to get the recommended Java for your computer.
And there is no yellow button… But anyways there is this button that says download java now, So i click that
And it goes back to the page that Has me verify my java… -.- And it keeps doing that whole process. And I really want to start playing all my servers again but I cant
NOTE: If you recently completed your Java software installation, you may need to restart your browser (close all browser windows and re-open) before verifying your installation.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with java! :(
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

[quote=“King Lingerz, post:12, topic:258092”]Hmm. You didn’t answer his question either skiller.

Download the latest version of Java, JDK and JRE. Post any problems.[/quote]

I’d like to congratulate you on repeating what Pimped tut and I have said in previous posts.

-clap[quote=“skiller noob1, post:10, topic:258092”]Notice: Quit acting smart by getting technical, Java is server related. Just not directly. [/quote]

King, Its server related…

download JDK from java.sun.com and then set the classpath in the run.bat and it should work.

No, you need help with Java, not with a server. Read your own title.

Take time to read the post next time…
